info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 8:21PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Chesterfield, southern Cumberland, east central Prince Edward, northwestern Nottoway, Amelia and southwestern Powhatan Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 821 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rice, or 8 miles east of Longwood University, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Jetersville around 835 PM EDT. Morven around 840 PM EDT. Amelia Courthouse around 850 PM EDT. Chula and Scotts Fork around 855 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Goodwins Store, Raines Tavern, Angola, Pilkinton, Rodophil, Giles Mill, Winterham, Hawk, Paineville and Maplewood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central and south central Virginia.
